tutorial.title: Setting Size and Borders
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to change the size of your elements and use the border property.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
When done right, websites give you the right information in a fast and easy way.

Let's learn about one of the easiest ways to prioritize information: changing the size of elements or adding borders.

lessons.title: Height
lessons.interactiveContent:
To change the height of an element, we use the height property.

Make sure to pick height.

lessons.title: Width
lessons.interactiveContent:
To change the width of an element, we use the width property.

Make sure to pick width.

lessons.title: Pixels
lessons.interactiveContent:
We measure the height and width of an element in pixels, like 50px. Pixels are tiny points that make up what you see on a screen.

Make sure to pick 50px.

lessons.title: Paragraph width
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can change the height and width of any element on a webpage.

Set the width of the second paragraph to 150px.

Make sure to pick 150px.

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the unit of measurement for the size of elements?

PixelsHeight

Make sure to pick Pixels.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What stands for 50 pixels?!

50px50%

Make sure to pick 50px.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property changes the height of an element?

heightwidth

Make sure to pick height.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set height to 100px in this rule?

All h1 elements have their height property set to 100pxThe font-size property is set to 100px

All h1 elements have their height property set to 100px.

lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make this rule double the width of the other by typing width.

Make sure to type width.

lessons.title: Example 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the height property for elements of the mainPhoto class to 200px.

Make sure to pick height followed by : and then 200px, ;.

lessons.title: Example 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the height property for elements of the square class to 100px.

Make sure to pick 100px.

lessons.title: Example 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the width property for all p elements to 250px by typing width: 250px;.

Make sure to type width: 250px;.

lessons.title: Borders
lessons.interactiveContent:
Elements on a webpage can have borders around them.

To see how it looks, add the border property.

Make sure to type border.

lessons.title: Borders
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make the border appear, we set the value to solid.

Make sure to type solid.

lessons.title: Border width
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set the width of a border by adding a number in pixels right after solid.

Here, we can create a wider border by setting its width to 10px.

Make sure to pick border followed by : and then solid 10px, ;.

lessons.title: Border color
lessons.interactiveContent:
To set the color, let's add red at the end of the value of border.

We can make this border red by setting the color value to red.

Make sure to pick red.

lessons.title: Border radius
lessons.interactiveContent:
border-radius is a property that rounds the corners of an element. If we set the radius to 10px, the border curves 10px before the corner.

Make sure to pick border followed by - and then radius, 10px.

lessons.title: Other elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
border-radius works on all elements, even images. It's an easy way to make images look great on a webpage.

To round the corners of all images using border-radius, type 100px;.

Make sure to type 100px.

lessons.title: Rounding an image
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make an image a circle, we set border-radius to half the width of an image. It only works if the image is a square though!

Make sure to pick 50px.

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's a border in CSS?

A line of a certain thickness and color around an elementThe element's background

A line of a certain thickness and color around an element.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make the border appear, which value is necessary?

The value solid is necessaryThe value 10px red is necessary

The value solid is necessary.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we round the corners of an element?

With the border-radius propertyWith the text-align property

With the border-radius property.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we set the color of a border?

By adding a color value to the border propertyBy adding a color value to the border-radius property

By adding a color value to the border property.

lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a border to the h3 rule.

Make sure to pick border.

lessons.title: Example 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make a visible border around all img elements.

Make sure to pick solid.

lessons.title: Example 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Round the edges of all img elements.

Make sure to pick border followed by - and then radius, 100px.

lessons.title: Example 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a border to all paragraphs by typing border: solid 50px;.

Make sure to type border: solid 50px;.

executableContent.instructions: Using the `img` selector, set the height and width to `100px`. Then, set a visible `2px` thick border around them.

files.name: index.html
files.content: My Favorite Things
